de.hs_duesseldorf.medien.mi.httphsdronelog.hsdronelog.network

Class HSDroneLogNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hs_duesseldorf.medien.mi.httphsdronelog.hsdronelog.network.HSDroneLogNetwork

  • public class HSDroneLogNetwork
extends Object
    This class provides the network requests to get data from a HSDroneLog web server. The data will be requested with POST method of HTTP. To receive the requested data you have to create a NetworkListener. This class is a singleton and works like an Adapter for the NetworkThread. It also creates a NetworkHandler to get the requested data in the UI Thread so you can perform UI modifications.
    Author:
    Ren√© Ebertowski

    • Constructor Detail

      • HSDroneLogNetwork

        private HSDroneLogNetwork(String webServerURL)
        Creates a new Network instance. A Network instance is used to send specific requests to a HSDroneLog server. This objects works like an Adapter Pattern for all parts of the network. Creating the network will also start the Network Thread.
        Parameters:
        webServerURL - The url of the web server to connect to.

    • Method Detail

      • networkInstance

        public static HSDroneLogNetwork networkInstance()
        Creates a network instance if no one exists. Otherwise it will return the existing network instance. So you can only have one instance of this object. (SINGLETON)
        Note that you have to set the url of the web server first before calling this method otherwise this method causes an IllegalStateException.
        Returns:
        An instance of the network class or null if no application context was set.

      • setWebServerUrl

        public static void setWebServerUrl(String webServerURL)
                            throws IllegalStateException
        Sets the url of the web server. Note that this can cause a IllegalStateException if an instance of this object already exists which is currently requesting.
        Parameters:
        webServerURL - The url of the web server.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an instance of this object exists which is currently requesting.

      • closeNetwork

        public void closeNetwork()
        Terminates the Network Thread.

        Note that you can not create another instance of network class.
        If you close the network you can not reopen it. Therefore you should only call this method if you close your app.

      • startRequest

        public void startRequest(NetworkListener listener,
                         Request request)
                  throws IllegalStateException
        Starts a new custom request. Note that there can only run one request at same time. The received data will be handed over by a NetworkListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The network listener to react to network events or to get the requested data.
        request - The Request object for the network request.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If there is running an unfinished request.

      • setNetworkListenerForNewRequest

        private void setNetworkListenerForNewRequest(NetworkListener listener)
                                      throws IllegalStateException
        Checks if a new Request is valid in the current state of the network and then sets the NetworkListener for the new request.
        Parameters:
        listener - The network listener to react to network events or to get the requested data.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If there is a current request.
